root.name: noLoop()
root.description:
Stops Processing from continuously executing the code within draw(). If loop() is called, the code in draw() begin to run continuously again. If using noLoop() in setup(), it should be the last line inside the block.
When noLoop() is used, it's not possible to draw to the screen inside event handling functions such as mousePressed() or keyPressed(). Instead, use those functions to call redraw() or loop(), which will run draw(), which can update the screen properly.
